items.title: Trump-backed candidate Asfura declared new president of Honduras
bullets: • Donald Trump-backed candidate Nasry ‘Tito’ Asfura declared the winner of Honduras’s presidential election
• He secured 40.27% of the vote, against 39.53% for the centre-right Salvador Nasralla
• The electoral council proclaimed a winner before completing the review of all tally sheets

items.title: Texas A&M System declines to reinstate fired lecturer despite faculty panel’s findings
bullets: • Melissa McCoul was fired in September after a video of her teaching about gender identity in a children’s literature class went viral
• A faculty appeals panel unanimously concluded that her dismissal was not justified
• The university system deferred the decision to the university system
• McCoul's attorney confirmed to The Texas Tribune that this sequence of events occurred

items.title: China just carried out its second reusable launch attempt in three weeks
bullets: • The first Long March 12A rocket, roughly the same height and diameter of SpaceX’s workhorse Falcon 9, lifted off from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center at 9:00 pm EST Monday (02:00 UTC Tuesday) The rocket's methane-fueled first stage booster hurtled through the atmosphere at supersonic speed
• The booster failed to complete a braking burn to slow down for landing at a prepared location near the Gobi Desert

items.title: ‘They’re scared of us now’: how co-investment in a tropical forest saw off loggers
bullets: • There are no roads through the Darién Gap, a vast impenetrable forest that stretches the width of the land bridge between South and Central America, but there is almost no way through it
• Like tropical forests all over the world, it has been steadily shrinking, with at least 15% lost to logging, mining and cattle ranching in two decades
• Panama has mounted a surprising fightback that could offer hope to the rest of the world’s forests

items.title: What went right this week: treating the ‘untreatable’, plus more
bullets: • A world-first gene therapy has reversed previously untreatable blood cancers, scientists said this week
• The technique involves editing the genetic code of donor white T-cells to target cancer cells without attacking the patient’s body
• Alyssa Tapley, 13, was the first in the world to receive the treatment, known as BE-CAR7

items.title: Trump’s war on offshore wind faces another lawsuit
bullets: • Dominion Energy filed suit against the Trump administration over its decision to pause federal leases for large offshore wind projects
• The move puts a sudden stop to five wind farms already under construction, including Dominion’s Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project
• The suit also argues that the “sudden and baseless withdrawal of regulatory approvals by government officials” threatens the ability of developers to construct large-scale infrastructure projects

• The card doesn't pile on extras like rewards, but if your goal is to stop interest in its tracks, it's a slam dunk
